title: Silent installation of OO Workflow Designer
content:
This section describes how to perform a silent installation of an OO Workflow Designer.

To install an OO Workflow Designer in a silent mode:

  1. From the extracted installation zip file, using a text editor, open the text file sample-oo-designer-silent.properties that has the required installation and configuration settings. 

  2. Save a copy of the text file as silent.properties.

  3. Remove the comment sign (#) from the properties that you need, and add the value for each of these properties.
  4. From a command line, type the following example code: installer-oo-designer-win-<version>.exe -gm2 -s c:\\temp\my-silent.properties
  5. To disable the extracting installation files progress bar, add to the command line -gm2 before -s.
  6. You can use the -n option if you don't want to start OO Workflow Designer after the installation has completed.
  7. The gm2 isn't supported with Linux.
  8. The -s property accepts either a full or a relative path depending on the operating system:
    Windows: Relative to the location of the .exe file.
    For example, if dirA is the current directory, and dirB located under dirA contains the installer and silent.properties file, open a command prompt window in dirA and enter the following command: dirB\\installer.exe -s silent.properties.
    You must add two backslashes \\ and not one backslash \.
    Make sure the installation folder where you download the installation file doesn't contain any spaces in the name.
    Linux: Relative to the location of the directory from where you launch the installer.
  9. Delete the my-silent.properties file.

Linux guided install option

As an alternative to manually editing the silent.properties file, you can use a script to perform a silent installation on Linux operating systems. This script collects the necessary data to build up the silent.properties file and install OO Workflow Designer through a series of questions. The script is called oo_workflow_designer_guided_install.sh and is located under the config folder in the zip file. 

The script generates a silent.properties file in the same location from which it's being run and can trigger the silent installation for the product.

To install OO Workflow Designer on a Linux server using the guided installer follow these steps:

  1. From a command line, run the oo_workflow_designer_guided_install.sh script.
  2. Fill in the requested details when prompted.
  3. Leave the prompt blank if a value is set between square brackets to use that value as default.
  4. After providing all the required information, you will be prompted to start the silent installation.
  5. If you type <yes>, the script prompts for the OO silent installer location and starts the silent installation.
  6. If you type <no>, the script displays the contents of the generated silent.properties file and exits installation.

All files generated by the script will be located in the same folder from which the script is being run.

OpenText encourages the customer to delete the <my-silent.properties>, which isn't provided by OpenText. By not deleting the properties file you may be exposing the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. The Python Executor will install on the default port for OO Workflow Designer (8003). If the port is already in use, the Python Executor service won't start and Python based expressions will continue to be evaluated with the Python interpreter. To change the port for the Python Executor please follow the instructions on the Configure Python Executor page and restart the OO Workflow Designer service.
